Reviews.Title: “Good location and perfect view!”
Reviews.Author: Thanasis F
Reviews.Content: The shuttle bus is very helpful and costs 1.5 euro per person. The breakfast is perfect and has a great variety. The bar and the barman is a good choice to finish your day after a crowdy day in rome. The view is unique!

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY SUPERB RECEPTION STAFF”
Reviews.Author: TheMasonsHavana
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a quiet part of the city. The shuttle bus service to the centre of the city was very useful and cheap (twenty five minutes in traffic and ten minutes without traffic). Comfortable rooms and an excellent buffet breakfast. Without exception all the reception staff were extremely helpful and friendly and could not do enough for us. They made our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful,quiet and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: KatKate81
Reviews.Content: A really lovely hotel, pleasant staff and large rooms. The breakfast spread was varied and very tasty. The shuttle bus service was very usefull however didn't go on late enough if you wanted to experience a late night out. Stay here if you want a beautiful hotel out of the hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Next to a lovely park, a little way out of the city.”
Reviews.Author: Chris Y
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a Trafalgar tour and then booked in for a couple of extra nights. It is a lovely hotel in a residential area of Rome and situated next to a lovely expanse of parkland. The main problem is the distance form the city and the fact that you are not on easily accessible public transport routes. However, the hotel runs an excellent and reasonably priced shuttle service to the Vatican on the hour. I would recommend this if being 'close to the centre' is not a high priority for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: JWS1991
Reviews.Content: This hotel was AMAZING.. I have a high standard when it comes to hotels and this lived up to my expectations. The food was to a high standard but a little expensive. And the free breakfast buffet is exceptional value. Rooms are a great size and the free shuttle in to the Vatican City was a bonus and saves you a few pounds also. My downside to our stay was the staff. I did not find them helpful what so ever and that they were very blunt. This did not affect our stay though. If you are going to Rome stay here !! The spa was the best I have ever visited.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly convenient for the airport.”
Reviews.Author: Jenny C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good conference hotel, is relatively near to Fiumocino Airport, but not convenient for visiting the city. The restaurant was not very inviting in the evening and there were no restaurants nearby. The breakfast was quite good. My room was warm, once I had worked out how to use the heater - we were there when it snowed!

Reviews.Title: “Isolated with frustrating service gaps”
Reviews.Author: shawbee99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Atahotel for 4 nights attending a conference being held on site. The hotel is not located near anything. There is a shuttle bus to the vatican area which costs 1.50 euro, taxis to the central areas of Rome cost between 15 and 25 euros. While the setting in a park affords a certain peacefulness and the rooms are of decent standard, the hotel comes up short in a number of areas. The main restaurant in the hotel has awful service, resulting in over an hour wait for soup one night, even though the place was virtually empty(3 other tables). The quality of the food in the restaurant, room service and during the meetings was all very good however. The bartender in the lobby bar disappears for long stretches of time leaving the guests waiting. Don't try dialing any of the numbers listed in the room for front desk, room service, etc- no one answers any of them. Dial the operator and you might get an answer. The antiquated and slow wi-fi system also left a lot to be desired. Overall this hotel was of average standard with frustrating inconveniences, which made the stay memorable for all the wrong reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: groovywilma
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night at the end of a wonderful Trafalgar tour. It was clean, comfortable and well decorated. The water pressure in the bathroom was good. The room was spacious with a balcony overlooking the pool. We were unable to figure out the heater and felt a little too warm while sleeping. I wish we had more time here. I wish I could go on my trip to Italy again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Villa Pamphili Hotel is excellent”
Reviews.Author: ReadersouthernUSA
Reviews.Content: By all means stay in this hotel if you are in Rome. Though it is not in the middle of the tourist sections, it is very nice and has beautiful views! You can take a taxi from your hotel to the sites and you will be able to return to a relaxing night's sleep! I admit I did not think that when I first realized our Globus European Tapestry Tour was putting us there, but having been there I totally agree! But we were able to go see what we wanted and thoroughly enjoyed Rome! By the way, I would also highly recommend the Globus Tour we took!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: RoxIt
Reviews.Content: good location in a quite green corner of city center.the hotel has excellent pool, tennis courts, gym and spa center .Staff is very nice and helpfull. Room are large and clean with balcony, some furnitures and carpets look old and need a renew. Breakfast is excellent. The hotel has an excellent bus shuttle service to the downtown ( stops at Piazza Risorgimento closed to St.Peter square) .

Reviews.Title: “Spartacus was outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: Hotel1Ldn
Reviews.Content: My partner and I celebrated a 50th Birthday by visiting Rome. Our stay at the AtaHotel Villa Pamphili was truly fantastic. After tiring, busy and loads of amazing days visiting the magnificent sites of Rome and the Vatican, it was a pleasure eating a few evening meals in the hotel restaurant. A very kind and helpful gentleman named Spartacus ensured everything was perfect. He is truly an outstanding team member, and a huge credit to the Villa Pamphili establishment. The staff in general were all very friendly, helpful and polite. There is a bus shuttle to the Vatican that is efficient, or one can simply use a taxi service which is an approx 20 minute ride to central Rome. If like us, peace, quiet and comfort is important, then this is the hotel for you. The rooms were clean and pleasant. We will stay here again. UK mature couple - ages 45/50 -

Reviews.Title: “A well run hotel in Rome with easy Vatican access”
Reviews.Author: rbuckell
Reviews.Content: A truly well run hotel in a park setting but with easy and free transport to Vatican City. The rooms are large and well appointed, we had three beds, the breakfast is excellent and the staff so helpful. The dinner buffet is good but a little expensive and better value can be found in the city. The hotel bus runs till 10.30pm so a city dinner and bus back is good. The best thing about the hotel is its efficiency, its well run; unlike most of the Rome attractions, so its nice to get back and relax. As to the Rome attractions, book on line to avoid the queues which can be very long. A Roma Pass is very useful.

Reviews.Title: “High standard in de luxe rooms”
Reviews.Author: Axel650
Reviews.Content: Nice quite location, very nice staff, clean and high standard in de luxe room with open sun balcony towards south

Reviews.Title: “Needs work.”
Reviews.Author: DenduA
Reviews.Content: As in any other hotel in Italy, this one needs improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Half Term 2011”
Reviews.Author: Kirx
Reviews.Content: The hotel is light and airey, rooms as you would expect in a 4* European hotel were clean, well maintained, new and nicely decorated and the facilities like the Spa were very good if you were prepared to pay the highish prices for them. The rooms at the back of the hotel have a very nice view over the pool (closed unforts in Oct) and the surrounding countryside. The shuttle bus is a little limiting, but if you planned your day the day before you could book appropriate times in to and out of Rome, it was also free. The biggest problem for us throughout the week was how unfriendly the staff were. Not all of them, the breakfast staff were very attentive and smiley but reception at the Reception was abrupt and often unwelcoming and the elderly gentleman serving at the bar at lunchtimes was just plain rude! It is for this reason that I would not return to this particular hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming as always”
Reviews.Author: figliadellalluna
Reviews.Content: By now, I always stay at Hotel Villa Pamphili while in Rome. The beautiful view over the park is inspiring from the room balcony or the porticoed terrace bar. In June, I was able to try the newly opened spa, which is quite elegant. It was sad to see the restaurant change completely from menu to buffet service, but the food is always good with many choices. Anyone who thinks it expensive probably chooses what Romans consider fast food type eateries when in the city, and hasn't paid for a true restaurant meal in Rome. This could be an argument for keeping menu service, but even hotels have to make hard choices in these economic times. Bus service and taxis are always available to those who wish to eat elsewhere, which is what one usually ends up doing anyway when staying in the center. Over all, my stays here are consistently refreshing and relaxing...a tall order in a city as chaotic and noisy as Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Location”
Reviews.Author: mack15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property on the last night of a Globus Tour. It is a very nice, clean hotel, but it is not located near any attractions. It is a great location to unwind and relax after a two week tour, but would not recommend it for someone wanting to experience the Roman nightlife. Globus drove us into the inner city to a nice restaurant for our farewell dinner. The hotel staff was very friendly and helped us arrange transportation the next morning. The rooms were very spacious and clean and the included hotel breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “No Atmosphere,”
Reviews.Author: jenzy10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend at the beginning of August. the only good things I can say is that the rooms were nice enough, bed was huge and comfortable and the place was very clean. Being at the front of the hotel we did experience some noise due to coaches arriving early in the morning. But that in itself was not really a big deal. The shower (over bath) was not working properly. Could not adjust the temperature so got scalded each time. Again even this would not cause me to write a bad review about a place. I'm not a fussy traveller but this place just had no soul. The staff were indifferent at best and often rude and unfriendly and we did not feel one bit welcome. We had hoped it would be a nice place to retreat to after a day's sightseeing in Rome but instead we felt isolated and trapped because there was no atmosphere in the hotel and since it literally is in the middle of nowhere we had little alternative but to retire early. The bar is not a bar, just a one man show at a small counter in the hallway with a very limited drinks selection. The bar man was cranky and could not cope if under pressure. Breakfast was ok but forget about dinner. It was atrocious. We went into the restaurant the first night we arrived as it was late and when we saw what was on offer we walked out again. I even tried a massage in the spa and it was the worst massage I ever got. The shuttle bus works out ok but given the location of the hotel it really has to provide this or people would not stay there. I promise you I am not a finicky traveller, I don't mind scuff marks on the furniture or other minor details that other guests complain about. But please do yourself a favour and find somewhere else to stay when in Rome. This place is soulless.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl P
Reviews.Content: This was a very bad experience. Very bad location always waiting for a bus to get to town. If you ate at the restaurant it was vey expensive. The last day we were there we ordered a box breakfast for the morning because we were leaving at 5:30 AM. The desk clerk gave us our meal in a box and asked us not to eat it in the loby as it had just been cleaned,so we had to go out side and eat it. Over all is was a very bad experience. Won't go back

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: rocco242413
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Villa Pamphilli hote. This hotel was very clean and helpful. The breakfast was good, staff was friendly and they also provided a shuttle bus to vatican city which was so helpfull. they also had a spa for you to relax. i will be going back there again. thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Lovely Location”
Reviews.Author: Louise V
Reviews.Content: Just come back from staying at this hotel for 5 nights (and got engaged there as well!) and we were both very impressed. The hotel is in great condition and the rooms and public areas are well maintained. The staff were very welcoming and accommodating, even though we were there very early to check in. The pool area is beautiful and location is great- staying outside of rome (only 10 mins drive away by *free* shuttle) means you can relax by the pool by day when it's too hot to walk around and then go in during the afternoon- best of both relaxing holiday and city break. Would definitely stay here again, out of all the hotels I've booked in Rome this has by far been the best.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: BrennanHampton
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights when we arrived Roberto on reception was very rude he had Italian conference people who arrived just after us and ignored us to see to them then said our room was not ready to come back in an hour which we did then he kept us waiting for another 3 1/2 hours the bar staff also rude exept for a lovely polish lady who works there and drinks very expensive, the pool was lovely just seems that they do not have much time for the English people that stay there as a few other people we met felt the same.

Reviews.Title: “Well Done”
Reviews.Author: mtp101
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family in this hotel; overall the experience was very good. Breakfast was excellent, rooms very good and transport into the city worked very well as long as we pre-booked and planned ahead by 24 hours. Staff, where polite and co-operative, we always got smile! The pool was a great feature and enjoyed by us all, great place to cool down after sightseeing around Rome. Overall a very good hotel, I would return, well done.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil but Isolated”
Reviews.Author: Dashworld
Reviews.Content: In a quiet location - suburban, set well back from a little-used street. I asked for, and got, a quieter room on the top (5th) floor and away from the lifts, and got two good nights' sleep in a very comfortable bed. There are many different reception staff throughout the day - all helpful though style ranges from the warm to the somewhat brusque. A good retreat from Rome's hustle and bustle but you do pay for that isolation. There are no walkable shops or restaurants so it's either a taxi ride or eating breakfast/dinner buffets in the hotel: food was OK, nothing more than that. Taxi costs are around 10 euros to Vatican City; 15 to Pantheon. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia R
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of its location to Vatican City and it had a pool, an amazing pool. The hotel is beautiful. The room is very comfortable. The free breakfast was delicious, more than just your typical continental items. The shuttle bus was very helpful. If you booked ahead of time, you were assured a spot. The staff was pleasant and we were very happy with our stay. There is not much within walking distance but the shuttle service helped tremendously. This is a true gem in Rome. Would love to return if ever in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “We really liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeorgePJS
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife. The trip was originally planned for her and a friend, but her friend couldn't make it, so I stepped in. Hotel was very comfortable. We stayed in a "Superior" room as this was the option for twin beds when originally booked. Room was clean and tidy. Balcony was adequate and had could easily accomodate a table and 2 chairs. Breakfast buffet was included and was varied- fruits, cold meat and cheese, cereal, eggs, bacon and Italian sausage. Pool was larger than most city hotel pools (about 30m x 15m- 95ft x 45ft), and went from 1m to 1.5m at the shallow end, then dipped to approx 2.5m. (3ft-5 ft; 10ft) Staff were unfailingly courteous and helpful. English ability varied, but it appeared that at least some staff could also speak Spanish, German and Russian, and it is unreasonable to expect hotel staff to be fluent in languages, unless they are booking managers. A small problem was the evening meal. There was an option of buffet or a la carte. The buffet was €28 per person, including bottled water and coffee. However, the a la carte was quite expensive, so there was no real option for someone who just wanted a light meal. Having said that, the buffet included fruit, cheese, salad, grilled vegetables and similar antipasti, two pasta choices and two cooked choices- fish and meat, and if one was vegetarian or had intolerances, it would be perfectly possible to have a nice and substantial meal while avoiding certain items. The shuttle bus left the hotel on the hour from 8:00 to 22:00, and arrived in central Rome (near the Vatican) about 15 mins later, and left the pickup point at 20 mins past the hour. Those wanting an early start or late pickup needed to book a day in advance. We travelled into Rome between 11:00 and 13:00, and returned between 16:20 and 19:20, and there was no problem. The bus is not restricted per se, but as it has approx 20 seats, it works on a first come-first served booking basis. It is perfectly possible for guests to just arrive and try their luck, but no guarantee if pre-booking was not made. Check-in and checkout were easy and professional. I would have no problem recommending this hotel to others, and I also noted that there were some couples with small children, who seemed to be perfectly satisfied with the hotel and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, far away”
Reviews.Author: J H
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a peaceful holiday, but if you want to see the city whenever you like then don't choose this one. Good: clean, great breakfast, friendly restaurant staff, peacefull area. Bad: location, thin walls, the minibus was allways full, unfriendly reception staff

Reviews.Title: “nice location away from hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: jim402
Reviews.Content: we stayed here as part of a tour group in August 2011. Location was quiet and comfortable. Ideal location for families. Clean and modern accomodations. Helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, big pool and rooms, but a bit far from things.”
Reviews.Author: slygirl2
Reviews.Content: Great balance if you have young kids. Half a day of sightseeing mixed with a half day of swimming in the big pool. Even has a playground. Can't walk or take public transportation to anything easily, so you are bound by the hourly shuttle bus (reservations a must, as it does fill up), or a lot of taxis at about 15 EUR each way into the city center. We reserved a Suite, which was big and slept 4 in a king bed and double sofa bed. Large bathroom with jacuzzi tub and separate shower. the huge bummer was the restaurant, where food was incredibly limited and lackluster, not to mention expensive. Because transportation into rome is a trip, the lack of decent food was made even worse. Service was good, but you could tell the hotel was thinly staffed. EVeryone was working hard, but there just weren't quite enough people. It's definitely a convention-style hotel, so no charm at all, but in terms of comfort and balance of things for a young family, it worked quite well.

Reviews.Title: “Overall is good but need improvement”
Reviews.Author: SKLHK
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my friend and stayed in Italy (Rome, Florence, Venice & Milan) for 8 days in early August. We rented a car at Avis for the entire journey. Rome was the first stop and we stayed 2 nights at this hotel. The hotel provides free car parking and free wifi internet. Its wifi connection was very good and fast (the free wifi connection in Florence & Venice hotels were no good at all). Its buffet breakfast was the best for my entire trip in Italy. The food was fresh and had many varieties. The shower was quite old and the water from the shower was not strong enough. Except this, I'd recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great for the family”
Reviews.Author: cal16561
Reviews.Content: stayed a few days before and after a cruise, excellent accomodation and friendly staff. the restaurant was expensive but the free bus into Rome helped and we just went into the city and ate at one of the many on street cafes. the room was amazing, everything you could want and I cannot place a single fault in it. the shuttle bus was a great way of getting in and out of the city and it stops just at the walls of the vatican, easy walking distance to St Peter's or the metro. After a hot day in the city and relaxing evening in the clean pool, a bit cold to begin with but you get used to it. The only problem was the price and range of the evening meals, too expensive for a family to eat and small portions for what you do get, the breakfast is on the other hand very good. The hot food and fruit were replenished very quickly and the orange juice was very good. all in all I would and already have recommended this hote, it is were we will be going back to on any trips to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended to everybody who wants to visit Rome!”
Reviews.Author: mimi231071
Reviews.Content: Nice, spacious and clean rooms (with jacuzzi!), correct and quick service, very nice and big swimmingpool, delicious breakfast (fresh orange juice), every hour a shuttle to and from the city-center! We had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “I recommend.”
Reviews.Author: PabloLiporace
Reviews.Content: Calm and beautiful area. Great for travelers with car. Great breakfast e nice accommodations. Free parking, breakfast e internet - great deal.

Reviews.Title: “hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: oralia_silva
Reviews.Content: like always , we stayed here for the second time. I love the shuttle that is there to take you to tha Vatican and back then the swinging pool for relaxing after a long hot day, the food is excellent choices, something for. every body

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: kmalf
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. The rooms are well appointed and very clean. The overall property is beautiful. Staff is courtesy and very helpful. The shuttle to the Vatican works well. It was very easy to get the tickets from the front desk. Very nice outdoor space. Free wifi is a great bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice experience”
Reviews.Author: kayfay
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Villa Pamphili for 4 nights at the end of june. It was definitely not within walking distance to any location but the shuttle to the vatican was so conveinient. It dropped you off right at the vatican walls and the metro was a 5 min walk away. The trade off being right outside the city was the pool for the kids. After long hot crowded days of touring the pool was a nice way to cool off and relax. The rooms were spacious and clean. The beds were very comfortable. The front desk was hit or miss depending on who was working. For the most part is was good, I had some instances where it was lousy but this didn't take away from the overall great experience too much. I will say that I emailed thehotel several times to ask about hotel/airport shuttles and I never received a answer. I ended up booking a private shuttle through Romashuttle which worked out fine. For 4 people and 5 pieces of luggage it was 50 euro. My father in law did not book in advance and paid 80euro at the airport. The included breakfast was quite nice. Eggs, bacon, breads, meats, and cheeses....we went to the night buffet once. It was expensive and just ok....All in all, nice shuttle which runs on the hour, clean rooms and awesome pool....One last thing, swim caps are required. They provide them and honestly they gave us a good laugh the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Great food, beautiful location, and awesome spa”
Reviews.Author: Lori_Young
Reviews.Content: The food and food service is outstanding. It's apparent that this hotel wants you to enjoy every bit of your meal. Having dinner or breakfast out on the terrace is a must for anyone liking a scenic view. The Hotel has been remodeled but the bathrooms need serious updating. The bathroom floors can get slick and for older people it will be a problem. If you book a room for two people, you will need ask for an additional robe and slippers when you arrive, for each room only gets one set. If you ask for anything from the front desk be aware that they are always busy and really don't have time for little details. The staff is friendly enough, but just not able to follow through on things. When using the phone, dial 3 as all the other numbers just ring and ring. Also note, that if you want extra towels (and you will) it will take hours before you get them. Again, it's the communication from the front desk to the cleaning staff. The cleaning staff is great and very helpful when you can get a hold of them. The pool is wonderful and the spa is great. Check out any of the services for the spa. Any of the massages are well worth the money. Marco is fantastic. The staff is very helpful and accommodating. The pedicures are not as thorough as what you would expect from the States, and they do not put top coats on hands or feet, so be prepared to loose your color by weeks end. Using the spa during your stay is very affordable and relaxing after touring the city. Getting a taxi at the Hotel is tricky. It can take half and hour or more and the taxi starts charging for the ride the moment it receives a call from the hotel. It can get pricy. Yes, the Hotel has a bus service, but it is always full and you need to book a seat well in advance. You also need to book in advance if you would like to return on the bus and you have to stick with that time commitment as you will not be able to make a last minute change. The bus stops at one place only which is by the Vatican so if you are touring the rest of Rome, you will either have to walk back to the bus stop or take a taxi. Getting a taxi in the city is very easy and affordable. When you call for a taxi from the Hotel, the front desk staff will give you a receipt with an order number and taxi name. This is your taxi, meaning it is not first come first serve basis. You can only take the taxi that was called for you. This can be very frustrating as you can have people order taxis later than you and they are picked up before your taxi arrives. All the taxis are private contractors and well, pretty much arrive when they can or want to. The front desk will always tell you that it will take five minutes for the taxi, but this clearly is not the case. The food and spa make this Hotel a five star, but the front desk staff and room accommodations make it a three star. Not everyone will want to use the spa or eat at the Hotel, so that is why it receives an overall three stars.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and swimming pool - but some clothes disappeared”
Reviews.Author: Kelvin20
Reviews.Content: It's a huge hotel, beautiful and luxurious. The rooms are large and clean, the breakfast is amazing and the swimming pool is a dream when you are in hot Rome. Everything seems perfect, but some clothes of ours happened to disappear. I can't prove it was the hotel staff, but it sure is suspicious. Anyway, it's a nice place, not so expensive, and the free transportation to the city center is most helpful, since the hotel is a bit far from everything.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Garome
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent. The staff was very curtious and helpful. The room was very clean with plenty of fresh Towels. Nice restaurant onsite. The hotel is located away from the crowds which was good and bad. There is a shuttle service offered free of charge by the hotel that will get you into the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sheronda
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a great hotel. The room was very spacious and modern. The lobby, the pool and the spa are very open, light and airy, which lends to a very relaxing atmosphere. Housekeeping is quite friendly and helpful, although they may be a bit short-staffed as my laundry was never ready on-time. The front desk staff was efficient although not super-friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: TravelCouple2513
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on a trip to Spain and Italy and Rome was the last city we visited. We knew we had to reserve the shuttle for our pickup and hence we tried to reach the hotel's phone number (given in the website) from Venice the day before we were supposed to reach Rome. We called from various places starting 24hrs in advance and no response. We tried to reach even the customer care who connected us to the hotel's reception.. Still no response. After a long struggle and 1KM of walk through the steep upslope with all our baggages, we reached the hotel to be met by the unfriendliest people on earth! The restaurant was over priced 28 euros per person - buffet) and the menu had 90% salad and 10% cooked food. The shuttle was booked all the time and hence we had to reserve atleast 2 days in advance. this made our vacation like a timetable routine and not a relaxed one! We paid 8euros for the internet which we NEVER used. When we tried to communicate this to the reception staff, they were rude and their tone suggested that they looked at us like liars. On the whole, this hotel is NOT WORTH a penny and I suggest you dont stay here!

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel staff I have ever encountered”
Reviews.Author: cal3650
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the AtaHotel Villa Pamphili June 2011. I travel the world on business and have stayed at hundereds of hotels and motels. By far the AtaHotel wins the award for the worst staff I have ever met!!!!! HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!!!! Do yourself a favor and find some other place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great place if u dont mind staying a little off the heart of city”
Reviews.Author: suman_sasmal
Reviews.Content: i was not expecting such a high class property for the price i paid. It really doesnt matter if u r not staying in the city center. their shuttle is very convenient and they reach u right at the gate of vatican and a metro. Rome is very well connected by public transport and u will find them everywhere. as a tourist, we went out in the mroning and returned late eveng. the hotel was just perfect. Breakfast was too good. my family enjoyed a lot.

Reviews.Title: “We Liked the hotel, but we weren't impressed with the hospitality of the city.”
Reviews.Author: DinoJaj
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent for all groups. The breakfast is good particularly if you have it early. Restaurant is kind of expensive, although everything is expensive in Rome. Make sure you check the prices before using anything (especially the minibar). We enjoyed our first trip to Rome, BUT I think the Italians have long way to reach our standards in UK. There are not enough litter bins in the city, no public toilets. The drivers have no respect for pedestrians. The food in Rome is nothing like we have in UK unless you go to Burger King, McDonald's or Subway which we used twice, but very expensive..

Reviews.Title: “Eveything was OK”
Reviews.Author: aldocono
Reviews.Content: perfect selection if you are using a car, good location to be outside of the roma center but near enough great value for money, clean and nice room, nice staff too. the breakfast was great

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice breakfast, excellent shuttle service!”
Reviews.Author: tdiddy1974
Reviews.Content: Rooms were nice and clean. Breakfast was really nice with plenty of choices. The fresh orange juice was AWESOME!!! The free shuttle service to the piazza next to the Vatican was super convienant! I would stay here again. Hotel in a nice area. Also, nice bar and patio area to relax in. Pool looked very inviting although we didn't use it. Dinner was just OK though, not a lot of pasta choices. Overall though, it was great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Peaceful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: charlielouisa
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days and had a lovely restful stay after the hustle and bustle of central Rome.The Park is lovely and so nice to see all the families out together. The shuttle bus was brilliant -book the day before for both trips and you'll have no trouble getting on. The large bedroom was spotlessly clean with bedding changed every day. Lovely breakfast so nice to have a large jug of coffee and a jug of hot milk. We ate in the restaurant twice.The buffet is 28 euros but includes a large bottle of water and as much as you can eat.The antipasta was especia;;y good and also the desserts but the mains were a bit boring. We found the reception staff very helpful and also the restaurant staff but the bar manager didn't really want to serve us and the drinks were expensive.Avoid the snacks,far too expensive. We will definately stay there again next time we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel/Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: MrsWalsh06
Reviews.Content: Reserved rooms in January and had our confirmation papers but on check-in they didn't want to give us the rooms we reserved. After arguing they finally got us in a room, but put us in a smoking room. When we informed them that I'm allergic to cigarette smoke and reserved a non-smoking room, they refused to put us in another room and said there was nothing they could do because they were all booked. Essentially, they refused to honor our reservation and made matters worse by forcing us to stay in a smoking room and we could smell every time our neighbors lit up cigarettes. To make matters worse, the walls are paper thin so we could hear every word of conversations our neighbors had. Also, we were put above the pool and bar area and at night we could hear the conversations and loud party noises as if they were in our room. There were NO outlets in the entire bathroom. I had to dry my hair out by the bed. Also, the hairdryer is useless so bring your own. The place is in need of major renovations. I was so thankful I carried my slippers from another hotel, because the carpets were so disgusting here that I wouldn't walk on them barefoot. Bed was hard as a rock and the room service menu left much to be desired, as did the restaurant. The location is terrible; rooms are disgusting, old, and in need of revamping; and the customer service was atrocious. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We recommend this quiet surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Tengs
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at the hotel during easter. Norwegian family with teenagers at 13, 17 and 19 We experienced the service as great. The bartender in the lobby bar had a great attitude - gave good advice on a daytrip to the coast with trams and trains.The hotel has its own bus that brings visitors to the center. This works smoothly - for all guests to book tickets. If you wish to travel into the city center at 09 or 10 in the morning you should book the night before, due to shortage of seats when all guest want to travel to the center. Some people complained and argued when they did not get seats (might explain why some write about poor service on this website). The return journey, we experienced often empty seats - so we always got seats even without tickets. Conclusion: The bus worked fine (with a little planning) Very quiet hotel - far from Rome's traffic. It was felt wonderful after visiting the bustling city. In the afternoon we visited the big park in the neighborhood, for exercise, picnic and relaxation. The breakfast is great. They bring you delicious coffee if you ask (skip the coffee machine). Make sure that breakfast is included. It is expensive to buy. Several of the hotel's services are quite expensive for example the great new spa in the basement and access to the internet.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel , including bus to city which is one big +”
Reviews.Author: ResarnHelena
Reviews.Content: Awesome Hotel , but its a bit far to the center of rome! Good breakfast ...

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful treatment of 'guests'; a hotel that couldn't care less”
Reviews.Author: CBH78
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel in the early evening after a long journey and the door did not work - not very welcoming! - no sign on the door to say it wasn't working and we went in through the fire exit. Waited 20mins in reception to check in behind a very large family group. Other staff milling around reception but nobody checked us in. When we were checked in, there was no greeting, and certainly not an apology for our wait. No chance of a smile, just a gruff handing over of the keycard. I enquired about the shuttle service for the following day. I was told I had to book. I said we would like to reserve places on the earliest bus as we were attending Easter Mass. The earliest bus with places was 12pm - totally useless. I explained that the shuttle service was the whole reason for booking the hotel and it had not been clear that the service had to be reserved and was so limited (one bus an hour with 15 seats). The man at the desk simply shrugged his shoulders and said I would have to get a taxi. He could not have cared less. I asked how much this would be and he said 10 Euros. Had it been my hotel, the taxi would have been complimentary in the circumstances, but there we go. There was nothing to stop the shuttle going more frequently - it is a ten minute trip into the city - up to three shuttles an hour both ways, and at one point there were two buses, so no excuses! Feeling we had little choice, we booked the taxi via the hotel. Yes, the taxi was 10 euros. BEFORE LEAVING THE HOTEL!!!! I queried this with the taxi driver upon seeing the meter and he said we had to pay for him to go to the hotel. Crazy. And certainly not made clear. I later suggested to reception they might want to tell their guests about this and, again, they didn't care. And literally shrugged their shoulders. The leisure facilities you think are included with your stay? Not the jacuzzi/spa area. Wanted to go for a half hour dip before it closed and we were told we would have to pay 20 euros each. Needless to say, we didn't, but this is just another way this hotel tries to rip off its 'guests' (and for those who need wi-fi, this draconian place charges for it). I was charged 3 days city tax for a two day stay - the final insult - especially as we had booked and prepaid via the hotel's own site. And the city as a whole is so expensive and full of hidden charges. Breakfast was nice on day one - we went down at 07:30. On day two, when we went down at about 9, it was chaos. Things weren't re-stocked (glasses, plates, food), service was non-existent (day 1, we had ahd tea brought to our table, day 2 it was self-service). We had to share dirty tables with other guests as there was a lack of room and the staff were completely overwhelmed. I have seen the hotel's response to a recent review from some students. That the manager who has responed seems to think it is okay to somehow blame the guests and exonerate the staff (even where there is an appparent scam!) exemplifies this hotel's attitude and it is little wonder that service further down the chain is so poor. Email correspondence prior to our stay was either ignored or, when chased, answered abruptly. In the main, it was ignored, including one or two essential questions. Perhaps try booking the shuttle by email in advance of your stay - but no guarantees! The shuttle service gets booked very quickly but is useful. Pool was (sadly) closed when we went so can't comment. Dinner very overpriced - about £30 a head for a buffet. Restaurant Pamphilli, the nearest, was acceptable, with lovely staff who were friendly and eager to please - a great contrast to the hotel! Basically, this is a nice hotel in the physical sense. It just needs a staffing overhaul. I have never left a hotel so disappointed and was happier at all the cheaper hotels, hostels and campsites we stayed at for the remainder. Just a shame that the Pamphilli was meant to be our bit of luxury on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Unwelcoming Customer Service and Hidden Fees”
Reviews.Author: Riley1988
Reviews.Content: The hotel was supposed to be stay four nights and pay for three on the site cheaphotels.com This was not the case. We were over charged. We also were expected to pay for 2 days of internet even though we only used it and fixed it to pay for one day. We are students and cannot afford all of this. The front desk workers were not nice and didn't understand or speak good English. I felt unwelcomed and afraid to ask for help or if I had questions. The free advertised shuttle was not free. There was a surcharge for the shuttle. This made me extremely upset. I would have been more happy to walk to the city. It would have been good exercise instead of the insulting added shuttle charges. The breakfast was tasty and the fresh orange juice was great. This was the only good thing about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, great shuttle service, free parking”
Reviews.Author: Burmese12
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this hotel, and found it to be a good base for exploring Rome. The free shuttle service to the Vatican is wonderful. We missed the return one day and caught a taxi which cost around 15 euro..not bad considering the distance and traffic. The hotel room was large, clean and quiet. I did read another review regarding the temperature in the room as being hot, and we actually felt that as well. The breakfast was great, no compaints there. We had a car, and we drove one night around the local area and stumbled across some local eateries, which were fantastic. If you find yourself at the bus stop waiting to be picked up and you have a spare twenty minutes to spare..line up at Old Bridge Gelateria...worth the wait. We saw the line every day and finally succumbed..yum!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for touring Rome”
Reviews.Author: TravelApril11
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located close to Vatican city in a quiet surrounding. Rooms are spacious with all amenities for a city stay; restaurant in hotel, very good breakfast selections. Bus shuttle to Vatican city free of charge every hour (reliable, freindly staff). Unusually high charges for WLAN in room; fitness center with high end equipment open 24 hours/day

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: goozballoon
Reviews.Content: The staff made me believe in Italian customer service again. They were very helpful and kind. The breakfast was amazing, the dinner superb, the view fantastic, and the spa inspiring. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that is trying to take some time off and just relax. It is very far from the city, but there are many options to take care of this minor issue. Only downside was the internet, which was very expensive... Then again, who goes to Rome to get on the internet?!!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lgatz
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here the last night of our 10 tour of Italy. It was the nicest and largest room that we stayed in during our tour of Rome, Florence, and Venice. It was large with comfortable beds. The bathroom was average. The ceiling of the bathroom was a bit scarey as you could see up into the duct work, a very different look especially in a private area. The hotel was located a bit away from all the sights, we didn't mind as it was our last night in Rome and our tour took us into the city for dinner. The breakfast was OK at best. The scrambled eggs were so runny I didn't have them and the bacon was also very undercooked, more so than the other hotels we stayed in. The pastries were good. The grounds were nice, the pool area must be nice in the summer when open.

Reviews.Title: “Well done Ata...”
Reviews.Author: Lyndon_J
Reviews.Content: This is what I call a "Wooow Hotel"! Clean Rooms, comfortable beds, elegant restaurant with superb italian dishes (they've got a really creative Chef), amazing newly opened Wellness center, always couteous staff (the Front office guys assisted me a even with my airline web-checkin), great location surrounded by the greenery of Vila Pamfili park. Reaching the centre of Rome was not too difficult as there is a Shuttle service up to the Vatican. Unfortunately the outdoor swimming pool is not open in march, many parts of the lobby are newly refurbished and some work were on progress. I personally reccomend this hotel to anyone who wants to enjoy the city of Rome away from the caotic city centre...

Reviews.Title: “Home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: figliadellalluna
Reviews.Content: An Roman friend recommended this hotel to me in 2009. I've stayed three times since then and think it's wonderful. The reception staff is superb, always helpful, kind and professional. The hotel restaurant is elegant yet comfortable for any reasonable attire, with a very respectable menu and wine selection. Buffets offered for breakfast and dinner are abundant, and a good value for restaurant eating in Rome. Room service is prompt. The wait staff is exceptional, offering quick, professional, helpful and very friendly service. This is a plus since the hotel is set in a tranquil park and there are no other restaurants in easy walking distance. However, a quick cab ride can take you to a wide variety of eateries, and the center of Rome is easily accessible. The hotel offers free shuttles to the Vatican area, where there is a large selection of restaurants and shopping, and access to the metro system. At certain times of year, another shuttle to Rome center is offered. The pool is huge and beautiful, and the tennis courts are popular. As a single traveler, I must say that the staff took particular care to make my stay as pleasant as possible. The location is quiet with a beautiful view over the park, and rooms are comfortable and well-appointed. There is a business center with computer access, and high-speed internet service available in the rooms, but through a service to which you must subscribe for a small fee, which would be my only criticism. However, as it is so simple to get pay-as-you-go mobile internet access in Italy now (stores are even in the airport), this is hardly an issue any more. During my visit in October 2009, I heard that a hotel spa was soon to open. On-line reservation service offers several types of discounted room rates, making this a great value. I've come to think of Hotel Villa Pamphili as my home in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with superb staff.”
Reviews.Author: rtaa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ata Hotel in Rome as part of a Globus Tour through Italy. The Ata Hotel was the last hotel we stayed at before returning to the USA. We actually had a mistake in our travel itnerary which left us without a hotel room the day before we flew home. We contacted our travel agent in the USA and she worked directly with the Ata Hotel staff to ensure we could get an additional night added on. When we arrived at the hotel, the staff (Roberto) knew who we were and took care of us. Not only did they give us a room for an extra night, they upgraded us to a better room for both nights! We had a balcony overlooking the hotel's beautiful pool and could see the city skyline. The hotel also offered a free shuttle in/out of Vactican area of Rome so we could sightsee on our extra day. The hotel is beautiful and the staff there is superb. I would recommend it to anyone staying Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Antonio and Mario were so helpful when...”
Reviews.Author: oralia_silva
Reviews.Content: Antonio and Mario were so helpful when we arrived without our luggage, they got on the telephone and helped us with the airline to recover or track our baggage. We loved our stay , the shutle was great and after a long day the pool felted great.the food was wonderful. 252 Oralia from calfornia

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel outside the city centre with its ups and downs”
Reviews.Author: Zazix
Reviews.Content: Atahotel was built as a luxury establishment, is stands overlooking a large park outside Rome, and has a beautiful architecture with lots of public space, terrace restaurant, large sporive open swimming pool, tennis courts, large lobby, elegant piano bar, restaurant with great food. The rooms are large and comfortable (ask for an executive room) have large comfortable beds, beatiful furnishings and decor. But the management lets it down. We booked an executive room at extra cost, but were surprised to see a tiny shower cabin instead of a luxury bathroom with bathtub as advertised. It took a lot of time to finaly change the room. Other guests then told us that upon arrival they received a free upgrade to an executive suite, while we payd the double and had to suffer. On the first days of our stay the hotel was full with tourist groups and the buffet breakfast was fantastic with a variety of salads, fresh fruits, hot dishes, freshly squeeze orange juice, choice of italian coffees and italian bakery and deserts.. delicious. We thought we would spoil ourselves every day. But after 2 days everything changed, the groups left, and the waiters took a leaf, instead in the restaurant worked only one very unfriendly manager. He started by shouting at me when I approched the coffee machine: seat down and dont stand up any more, you'll break it! only I can make coffee!! Well, Ok. but may i look at the buffet? yes. But there was no buffet. All the hot items disappeared. There remained some cold salads that remained from the previous days and stale bread. No fruit. No eggs. And everyday we saw only same stale items that remained from the group feast of the previous weak, plus this unpleasan man who eyed me to check that I dont make an extra cup of coffee. What a shame for a 4 star hotel! The same is valid for leisure facilities: the pool is closed in winter, so is the terrace. The restaurant got empty and I felt ill at ease sitting alone in the piano bar. Getting to the positive: the hotel provides a free shuttle to Vatican (10 min) every half hour, so it did, the drivers very polite and provided the service even when we were alone on the bus in heavy rain and never failed by pick us up from Vatican to bring back to the hotel. If you think it is far, I should say the location is not a problem, shuttle is fast, and from Vatican you can walk to the city centre, taxis are not so expensive, and anyway its hard to find a comfortable hotel in the historic part of Rome for a reasonable price. I think Villa could be a five star hotel but with a different management, now it is not more than 3.

Reviews.Title: “Isolated hotel needs updating”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugVA
Reviews.Content: Globus Tours switched our hotel at the last minute from a downtown location to the outskirts of Rome--the Hotel Villa Pamphili. Located near a sprawling park the hotel does not lend itself to exploring any local restaurants, which are far away. The swimming pool was under reconstruction. Many parts of the hotel needed updating. I was disappointed in the service from the start. The Front Desk staff questioned why we needed 3 extra pillows. I said because we are 3 persons in need of 1 extra pillow each. The response was....we might not have enough pillows in the hotel (which was far from fully booked). They ultimately did find pillows. The internet connection in the business center was ancient, slow and overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent relaxing hotel with huge pool”
Reviews.Author: dwam
Reviews.Content: We had a family room (junior suite) with two children. V comfortable and good size. Our view over pool and hills beyond was fantastic. Service excellent and helpful. Good buffet selection for main meal but expensive+ (28 euros/person for full buffet). Excellent breakfast included in our deal. Downside of having peace and the pool is that the hotel is ~4-5 miles out of the centre. Hotel has free hourly shuttle service to near St Peter's and another (2E) to Piazza Venezia. Both take 15-20 min. Alternative is no 8 tram (15 min walk) or taxi (~10E). Well worth the distance for the hotel and the pool if you have children.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - not close to city centre”
Reviews.Author: coopej4
Reviews.Content: I did like this hotel. I booked it because it had a pool (so that we could spend some time relaxing in between seeing the sites in Rome) and also because it had a shuttle bus to town. The free shuttle bus runs every hour to the Vatican. There is another bus that goes to Rome centre - but you have to pay for that one. For both, the bus only holds around 25 people, and you have to book the return journey. As you can imagine, it isn't easy to predict when you want to come back! When the bus is full - hard luck! Because of this we only used the bus to get to town, we arranged our own way back. The bus only runs until about 10:30 in the evening. We came back on the number 8 tram from Argentina Plaza - costs one euro, runs until midnight. You must be prepared for a 1.5 mile walk up and down 2 hills though. We managed it! Hotel - clean, staff speak English, plenty to eat for breakfast. Room service. Nice pool, newly refurbished. Free towels. Air con in the roome - great after the walk from the tram! Taxi to/from airport - around 50 Euros. Alternative is train to Trastevere - then taxi - or number 8 tram plus long walk! Would I stay there again? Yes if it was summer time - to take advantage of the pool. Winter time - no. Advice to the hotel - arrange a seperate bus service to the tram stop every half hour.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and spacious,friendly atmosphere would definitely recommend to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: muminsuffolk
Reviews.Content: Just returned last night from 8 days at the villa Pamphili hotel. Our family of four, including two children ages 10 and 16 found the hotel staff to be most welcoming.The location is a little tucked away but once the temperature rises the sight of the beautiful pool is very enticing. We only ate breakfast in the hotel as we prefer to sample different local restaurants and the hotel shuttle bus worked very well for us. We had booked adjoining rooms and this facility was perfect for our need, the housekeeping staff did a great job and the air conditioing never failed.Stefano the breakfast waiter was charming as were all the staff,we would recommend this hotel to friends without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “What a relaxing hotel stay.”
Reviews.Author: nikiG67
Reviews.Content: Having read veiws it would often seem people like to focus on the negative,so here is a good reveiw.Having just returned today I can say the room was great no noise and bigger than my first flat,bathroom was very clean and had everything and more in it and nice extra touches.The room was spotless and cleaned everyday.Staff could not do enough for us.Pool area had been recently updated and was a very welcome haven in the heat of August. Breakfast had everything for all tastes the evening meal was not the best i had on my trip and expensive but i had expected that.I did not take part in any tennis games but the courts were well looked after as were the gardens. The hotel had a free shuttle bus which it needed as it was fifteen mins to the vatacan.I have to say although it was out of the main city center i felt this was not a problem as it did not cause us sleepless nights due to noise,I had the best nights sleep in ages!

Reviews.Title: “a pretty good location for a great price”
Reviews.Author: FP4BMO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights in July as part of an extended Italian vacation. We booked this hotel through hotels.ca site and got the weekly rate for $800CDN dollars, a deal in our mind. Given some of previous reviews we were prepared for a moderate hotel and in our minds we were pleasantly surprised in many ways. We arrived and our reservation was acknowledged as being for 2 people when we had indicated 3, no problem, they quickly got a roll away bed/cot up to the room and we were set. Our room did show some signs of aging, the bathroom was clean but could do with some refurbishing, the room itself was in good shape but you could see that it would be due for a renovation in the next 12 months. They were busy renovating the public spaces while we were there. We did eat at the hotel, breakfast was included and was a nice variety of fruit, cheese, bread, eggs, meat and juices. We certainly got our fill at breakfast to offset the need for lunch. We did use the free shuttle on several occassions, as others have written, there are only 26 spots and once they hit the max there is no more space to allow for standees. We did encounter on a couple of instances where the bus was full and had to leave others behind either at the hotel or at the city drop spot. There can be a bit of a mad rush for the bus doors and even though you may be first in line, this order is not always adhered to, so be aware that you may need to exert yourself as there is little organization regarding the queue. We did use the pay bus service, $3 Euro per seat each way, keep in mind that if you do not book a return time/seat that the service may not come as it is driven by reserved seats, so even though a time may be scheduled, if no one has requested a seat on that scheduled run, the bus will not come. We used the internet in both the room and the business center, better value in the room but not as responsive as using the business center. We had dinner twice at the hotel, it can be expensive and I agree to stay away from the buffet and instead select the one or two items from the ala carte menu, similar price but you get what you want, anyway you slice it the price of food at the hotel can be expensive, and as others have mentioned there are no close by options for dinners. We used the pool most days and it was marvellous, large and clean, you have to wear bathing cap in the pool. The hotel was exactly what we were looking for, reasonably priced, clean, accomodating to our needs, the staff were very helpful, the front desk staff and Paolo the maitre'D in the restaurant. The room was of good size, we had a balcony facing away from the pool but it allowed us to wash out things at night and hang them over the chairs/table and have them dry by morning. A set cab ride from the hotel to the airport is $45 Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Atahotel Villa Pamphili”
Reviews.Author: YardieGal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Atahotel with my daughter and her friend on a trip to Europe for their 16th birthdays. The girls loved the hotel although it was a ways from Center City. The hotel provides a shuttle otherwise it cost about 20-30 euros via taxi. Get the address for the shuttle stop and times prior to going because I did not know and had to take a taxi to the hotel. The food at the hotel is very expensive and nowhere else around to eat so if money is a factor eat in Central Rome before returning to the hotel. We stayed at Atahotel for two nights/3 days and loved the cleanliness and view. The staff was not very friendly but for the price compared to other hotels in Central Rome I thought it was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL OUTSIDE CITY CENTRE”
Reviews.Author: PhilandMel
Reviews.Content: Booked our room through Hotels.com and really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is just outside the city centre, and is a fantastic escape from the bustle of the city at the end of long days sightseeing. ROOM: The rooms are large, with plenty of storage, a large comfortable bed and a spacious balcony complete with table and chairs. There was minor cosmetic damage to our room, but otherwise we were very impressed. The bathroom has a full bathtub and shower, and there were sufficient towels and complimentary toiletries. BREAKFAST: Is a buffet and quite expensive, though we ate plenty as it was usually too hot for lunch (except ice cream!) so it was good value in the end. Everything you'd want was available, fruit, cake, bread, meats, cheeses, and hot bacon, egg and sausage daily. All cooked well and replenished quickly. RESTAURANT: As others have noted, it is very pricey. However, order specific courses from the menu as the buffet is not very appetising. However the a la carte menu was fantastic with good portions. However, eat in Rome whenever possible as the food is amazing and very reasonable if you stray off the tourist streets. FACILITIES: The pool was fantastic and we spent a full day on the loungers by the side. The pool area has just been refurbished and is really fantasic, peaceful and surrounded by plants and views. Pool opens from around half 8 to around half 7 each day, is fully staffed and towels are provided poolside by staff. SHUTTLE: The hotel is not within walking distance of Rome, but the hotel puts on shuttle buses througout the day. An hourly (free) bus is available to the Vatican area of Rome, and although it fills up fast, there were always enough seats when we wanted to travel. Another, less frequent (€3/person/journey) bus is available to central Rome, and although this is a paid service you book a seat and therefore are guaranteed a seat and it's much cheaper than a taxi. For the more adventurous, the tram is within walking distance but the public transport system in Rome leaves much to be desired: dirty, confusing, irregular and extremely overcrowded (from our limited experience). I fully recommend this hotel and, if we ever return to Rome, would consider this hotel first.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis outside Rome!”
Reviews.Author: ALagosMarmol
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great specially after all day of walking in Rome. Superb swimming pool that we enjoyed a lot, specially with my grand daughter Isabel. The staff very helpful and the room was big ans spacious. I want to come back next year with my daughter and family. Thank you Rosa Moreno Casado Argentina

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, lovely memories, dinner was excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Shirley70
Reviews.Content: our tour stayed at this hotel in 2005, my room: nice, spacious, comfortable, yet elegant. grounds were very well kept..The staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD ACCOMMODATION, PITY ABOUT LOCATION AND ONE GRUMPY STAFF MEMBER”
Reviews.Author: Ray170
Reviews.Content: The room we had was very good as was the hotel surrounds. The location is unfortunate as it is a long way to walk anywhere so unless you have your own transport or decide to chance your luck on the shuttle service I would avoid this hotel. My introduction to the hotel was unfortunate when I asked "Mr Grumpy' if the hotel had a iron. He replied 'use laundry service'. He clearly misunderstood (so I thought) , so I said again, no I was just after an iron - response 'use laundry service'. I then asked for an area map and it was placed on the table in front of my and he was gone before I could ask any questions - no, he didn't have other customers to attend to! Day one of our stay we used the Restaurant for dinner we ordered off the menu and it was quite good. We recommended to others on our tour and they joined us for the buffet. The buffet was dreadful and when they ran out of something they didn't replenish.

Reviews.Title: “OK for one night, but wouldn't want more!”
Reviews.Author: wearytrvlr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to be closer to the airport for an early morning flight. We had heard about the unreliable shuttle, so we joined the group for a bus ride and a farewell to Rome dinner. The hotel is older, and not refurbished. The rooms were clean, but nothing special. We stopped in the bar to get a cup of tea, but didn't eat in the hotel, so I can't review that. It was quiet. Our tour group had arranged for a boxed breakfast, as wqe were leaving for the airport at 7, just when the dining room was opening. Each box contained different things. Some skipped the piece of fruit, some skipped the water bottle, some had mineral water, some had still, some had yogurt... it was like they threw whatever they could find into a box and charged the tour for 'breakfast'. Oh well, we ate at the airport! I'm glad I didn't stay here, but it certainly wasn't anything close to the hotels we started with in Rome!!! Globus Tours should look into finding somehwere else!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, terrible staff, unreliable shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: CanadianDeparture
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a beautiful quiet area in the south west area, just outside the main areas of the city. the problem with the location is that you are near nothing and need to rely on the unreliable free shuttle or pay a ridiculous amount for a taxi to go somewhere. One thing I was impressed with however is that we got bumped out of the shuttle because there were 60 people trying to get on a bus for 26 people. So we loudly complained because we would be stuck for a hour. they told us there was nothing they will do (which they didn't and we had to catch a cab), but the next day they actually added more times in the morning for the shuttle instead of just once an hour. If you do get stuck at the hotel and have to call a cab, I would recommened calling it yourself. For some miraculous reason the cab price seems to be cheaper when you do it yourself instead of having the hotel call for you....which lead me to believe that the hotel may make a commission on calling you a taxi. The hotel itself was clean and elegant. The room was large with a very large balcony, it was also very clean and the beds were very comfortable. If it wasn't for the staff this hotel would be really nice. Some of the staff at the front were nice but we found most to be kinda crusty. And brace yourself if you decide to eat at their restaurant. The food is average, and the staff are ignorant and crusty. there is a swimming pool here, but it doesn't open until June, that is also the time when they decide to turn on the air conditioning. This is a decent hotel, but I would recommened find a better hotel more centralized or close to a metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Italian Adventure”
Reviews.Author: Oklahomaretiree
Reviews.Content: The room was large and very comfortable. The staff was a little overwhelmed when we checked in, 5 tour groups were at the same time. The hotel is located in a quiet, residental neighborhood, but there are shuttle into the city every hour.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable overall but don't eat in the restaurant and don't rely on the shuttle.”
Reviews.Author: LJE79
Reviews.Content: On arriving at the hotel we were impressed with the overall look of the hotel. Our room was large, air conditioned and spotlessly clean with lots of little luxuries. The free parking was a bonus and the car seemed to be safe enough in the hotel's grounds. The hotel was excellent, how ever it had a couple of issues. We did make the mistake of eating in the restaurant the first night. It was extremely overpriced and believe it or not they had the cheek to serve frozen pizza and then charge you 15euros for it. The rest of the food was dreadful and breakfast was not much better but at least it was included in the room rate. One of the reason we chose this hotel was the free shuttle bus, as the plan was to leave the car and use that to travel to the city centre. The 1st day the 3pm didn't show up to return to the hotel so we had to wait til 4pm for the next one. With 2 small children that was no fun in the blazing heat. After that we decided to forget the shuttle and drive ourselves which was a lot easy than we thought it would be. However some of the roads had no markings and no apparent rules, a little scary but highly amusing. The swimming pool was lovely after sightseeing in the city. The kids loved it and we had lots of fun. The pool was worth being that little bit further out of the city centre. It was about a 10 minute drive from the vatican, 15 minutes from the colosseum, not very far at all. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful and we would definately return to the hotel when we visit Rome again. Tip - August is great time to vist as the city is empty so it's a tourist's playground. You just have to take it easy in the heat. Buy your drinks from the supermarkets as a can of soda can be as much as 6 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Fared glorie”
Reviews.Author: reizigerAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: The hotel has nice facilities, although somewhat fared glorie. The personnel was rigid and generally not overtly friendly or helpful, although there were a few positive exceptions. The bill for lunch was erroneously increased. This is really not a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too far away from Rome with a very poor courtesey bus”
Reviews.Author: thetholostwo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really only a 3 star. The room was bland and the en-suite bathroom smelled quite bad at times. Also, the view was of the generator which was noisy and smelly too. The breakfast was uninspired and the staff quite miserable. The pool was lovely which saved the stay for us. We spent too long waiting for a courtesey bus to take us into Rome and then people would push in and not everyone would get on.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eoing007
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel overall, sorry too tired right now to explain why, suffice to say we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel- great value for money”
Reviews.Author: CheltenhamRack
Reviews.Content: The only drawback about this hotel is that it is some distance from the city centre although there are two hourly shuttle buses to and from Trastevere and also the Vatican. A good tip is that tram 8 to Argentina square commences only a fifteen minute walk from the the hotel. Taxis to the centre cost about 15 Euros. The hotel is clean, spacious with a fantastic pool and attractive excellently maintained grounds. Each room has a balcony, and ours which overlooked the pool was fantastic. I would definitely recommend this hotel as long as you're not looking for serious nightlife in the hotel. Note the pool closes at 730pm in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable out of town hotel with pool, service hit or miss.”
Reviews.Author: travnan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Atahotel Villa Pamphili for 5 nights. We booked the family room and another individual room. Both were large, well furnished, very comfortable, and clean, with balconies furnished with a table and 2 chairs. Large bathrooms, stand-up shower and tub. We most enjoyed the large, clean swimming pool, and quiet time on the balcony. Some staff were friendly and willing to help us. Others acted put upon. Breakfast was included in the room price. There was ample food, including scrambled eggs, sausage and bacon. However, in Europe we learned that only in America can you get really crispy bacon. Fresh-squeezed orange juice was a hit with the kids. Otherwise, standard European breakfast: cold cuts, croissants, fruit, yogurt, cereal, a toaster (until they run out of bread, which happened every day, well before the 10:30 end time). Nice do-it-yourself coffee machine with lots of choices. The restaurant staff is helpful and somewhat friendly. They serve a lunch and dinner buffet for 28 Euros per person. The food in no way has the quality to warrant such a high price. We had to eat dinner the first night, but were not at all impressed. There is room service, however, when we ordered chicken bites and vegetable soup at lunchtime they said it would take an hour, so we canceled the order. The 2 shuttle van stops are near the Vatican Museum and Trastevere train station. The Vatican shuttle stop is next to a Metro stop - very convenient! More than once we had to wait 1/2 hour at the Vatican for the next shuttle back to the hotel as there were too many people to fit. The vans hold 16 - 19 people. We would either go down the block to get a Gelatti (ice cream), and wait, or walk up the block to the Taxi stand. Taxi fares from town to the hotel varied from 9 to 16 Euros, depending on your location. A Cab ride to either the airport or Termini train station takes 30 minutes. TIP: Study where the metro stops are on your map of Rome. And try to get a bus schedule in advance to learn which busses go where. Take the OPEN TOP bus tour to get an overview! Also, the restaurant down the block from the Vatican Shuttle stop, called "La Rusticella" is wonderful! Great food and wine, very friendly service and reasonable prices! Very convenient to shuttle - no need to eat at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Decent but with some flaws”
Reviews.Author: royalhammer
Reviews.Content: Overall I thought this was a good hotel. Although it is situated quite a bit outside Rome, the free bus service to Cipro metro station is extremely useful. The Roman metro is extremely handy and a week long ticket for unlimited use costs 16 Euro. Although it is advisable to queue for the bus at least 10 minutes in advance as we were left behind on certain occasions as there was no room. However, the drivers will often do a return run if there are people left waiting, especially late at night. The bus stop is also just a 10 minute walk from the Vatican Museums and a further 10 minutes from St. Peters. The rooms are decent if a bit small but the cleaners do a fantastic job every time. A big advantage of the hotel is the very large pool with complimentary towels. The breakfast buffet is another big plus. However, with regards to meals in the hotel, I would strongly suggest not having lunch or dinner as the prices are far too expensive. There are several fantastic restaurants within five minutes of Cipro station (La Rustichella just opposite the church being my favourite) which are so much cheaper. One aspect of this hotel which did not impress me was certain staff members. While some were extremely polite and helpful, I found many to be slightly unwelcoming and almost rude. The staff at reception were sometimes very abrupt in dealing with us while at breakfast, I don't think we received a "buon giorno" at all, we were just told where to sit. But because we were out and about pretty much all day every day, our dealings with staff was minimal. If you are coming to Rome to get out and about all day then I would definately recommend this hotel. However, unless you have money to burn, meals in the hotel (apart from breakfast) is not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “sightseeing and relaxation by the pool - 2 holidays in one”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth065
Reviews.Content: Myself, my sister and two nieces (15 and 16) stayed here for 6 nights. It was wonderful. The courtesy bus is very convenient. We found a great restaurant La Rustichella (green awning/green door) across the street from where the courtesy bus lets you off at the metro station - highly recommended ! cheap and great food, where all the locals eat. It was grand to then get on the metro and go off for the evening, or walk to the Vatican. Although the bus was rather full on some evenings, a phone or two and the hotel provided an extra bus on some of the nights. Word of advice: don't be shy about queuing or trying to get on the courtesy bus! some of the other guests were quite pushy. It pays to be a little early before the secheduled time. Taxi is about €15 to the hotel if you miss the bus. Pool = great. they provide towles and hats and loungers with little shades on them; marvellous for reading and sunbathing without the glare. Clean bathrooms and rooms. Food and drink far too expensive (4.50 euro for a small coke). I got the room on first floor right above the entrance and it was quite noisey. However, they switched us to a room right above the bar, which was only a little noisey, but quietened down by 12.00. Next time i would ask for a room on one of the higher floors. Breakfast had lots to choose from. The teenagers were well happy with the pool. Great to do a morning/afternoon sightseeing and then into the pool until the evening. After doing "bijoux" in Paris, I couldn't bear the thought of sleeping in a noisy, cramped "hotel" for the same price (I got a good deal on the internet). Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay on the western edge of Rome - free parking!”
Reviews.Author: Patrick M
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for three nights in room 526. I booked through expedia. Well, we were very surprised at our booking at this hotel. It is a very nice hotel in the ATA Hotel chain. It has all the amenities of a 4+star hotel. Our room was ready when we checked in and we were very pleased with it. There were two single beds a table and big balcony with a table and seats. The bathroom was big with tub and toilet/bidet. The room was clean and housekeeping did a great job each day we were there... ALSO, I almost forgot they do the nightly turn-down service with the chocolate left bedside. We felt pampered at this hotel. The room had a big plasma with internet access through the TV and in-room movie's (check prices! - if you need to access internet and print anything like maps then go down to business centre on -1 level where you can use it for an hour for 5euro and print away!). The hotel has a HUGE swimming pool open from 9:30 - 19:30. Swimmers are required to wear swimming caps and they even provide them for free. The pool is great, especially after a long hot day walking around Rome. We wished the hotel would keep the pool open later than 19:30 in the summer especially since the sun doesn't set until 21:30 or so. The hotel offers a free shuttle van service to and from two destinations - one the northwestern edge of vatican city near the Cipro Metro stop (red line) and the other at a train station at the south of the city centre. The hotel staff provide upon check-in a map of Rome. On this map is information about the shuttle van service and pick-up/drop-off times. The driver's we experienced did not speak english well at all. They were quite funny when yelling "Mama-Mia" when a scooter would cut them off in traffic. They got us around safely during our stay and so I appreciate their efforts. Quick note about the vatican - Ladies must wear appropriate clothing to enter St. Peter's. No sleeveless attire (bring a silk scarf for your shoulders in your bag on hot days), no swimsuits and no short-shorts for ladies. The security will deny entry to anyone improperly dressed. As for getting around Rome you cannot beat the 1euro fare on the Metro and buses... you get to travel for up to 75mins on a 1euro ticket - this is GREAT! Walking around is fun, but also doing a bit of traveling by Metro meant we got to see a bit more of the city and its' sights. We had the buffet breakfast each morning and it was big. Plenty to choose from, a few types of eggs, bacon, sausage, pastries, cereals and some other hot food items. They also had this great orange juice machine.
