You pulled on the handle and a few oranges dropped into this crusher and then my glass was filled - and it was the BEST juice I had on my enitre four week holiday around Europe! The staff at breakfast were very friendly and anticipated our drink selections each morning after the first breakfast. Everything at breakfast was perfect. The hotel also has free parking for guests - which came in VERY handy for our trip to Rome. If you are driving into Rome you should consider staying here as driving around Rome is a nightmare! One way streets all over the place and not so very polite drivers. Sort of like something you'd see on the old Benny Hill show. Park here for your stay, take the free shuttle service and relax in Rome. There's a good Chinese restaurant near this hotel - email me for info.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: kateDerryN_ireland
Reviews.Content: We are a party of six aged between 54 -65 our first time in Rome We were totally surprised by our great hotel as other travelers had indicated 4 star was not the same as our 4 star at home but I have to say it was much more We booked through last minute .com it was half the price you would normally pay We had bed and breakfast It was buffet style hot and cold meals with plenty of choices a good start to your day. Rooms were spotless clean bed linen and towels everyday hairdryer and toiletry supplied When you came back after a tiring day you would arrive to find your light on and a chocolate beside your bed the beds were very comfortable The courtesy bus was a big plus and it left you at the metro the metro was very easy to use and we made very good use of it We would recommend you take a trip on the open top bus which is located beside Termini station we went two days 23 euro we could hop on and off we stayed 5 days in Rome and at the end we felt we could give a tour ourselves we did a lot of walking I would recommend shoes that are comfortable even sandles no heels We were on a budget so we took a flask and made up sandwiches and sat outdoors during the day it was great watch out for service charges check before you go in many display no service charge now that the euro is the same as the pound it makes it more expensive for us beer and spirits are expensive but you can get a good bottle of wine in the off license for 4 euro We also found a great pub called The Abby Theater it was an Irish Bar first class Burger and chips and and Fish and Chips plus a drink for six people 62 euro great service near the Piasso Novena side street ask any one its the only irish bar we found the metro is 1 euro buses are 1 euro 58 euro for 6 to the hotel from the airport i would recommend as we arrived at night We had a great time would recommend this hotel only draw back no tea making facilities in our room but I always take a kettle with us Derry N Ireland 17th April 09.

Reviews.Title: “Super Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: share505
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel with great staff. The breakfast was very good but evening meal was expensive for what you received. The courtesy bus was excellent and the drivers were so helpful to us with a disabled member of our family. Courtsey bus was late one day and the hotel provided a free taxi, could not have asked for better. Lovely quiet location for the kids. thoroughly enjoyed are stay and look forward to returning in the summer months when the pool is open.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility and Space”
Reviews.Author: CailinJazz
Reviews.Content: Where does one begin? One of the best things about this hotel is the wonderful service - right from the warm welcome at the reception, the friendly courtesy at the bar (not to mention excellent drink choices), and the delightful enthusiasm of the maitre d' in the restaurant. My partner and I were made to feel like stars right from the outset! The rooms were spacious, very clean (the bathroom was particularly luxurious!), and our room, on the fourth floor, was on a corner so there were balconies with views both to the East and the North. I didn't get to use the swimming pool but from the outside, it looks great. One of the best features of this hotel seemed initially to be a disadvantage - its distance from the centre of Rome. It is approx 3km from the Vatican and a similar distance from Trastevere - so a 10 - 13 euro taxi ride. However, its location in a rolling park area of Villa Doria Pamphili means that it is really quiet and tranquil. My previous stay in Rome 10 years ago was in a city centre hotel - and the sound of traffic was unbearable. In Hotel Pamphili, I slept like baby. And the restaurant - although a typical hotel restaurant, the service which was excellent and the food which was delicious (try the insalata polpino with orange!). My only criticism is a small one - I have to declare my interest as a jazz singer but please please please invest in getting the bar piano tuned, and tell the singer/ piano player he can perform without recourse to the horrible electric casio backing track! Otherwise, a wonderful stay - Grazie Molto!

Reviews.Title: “Far from the Madding Crowds....”
Reviews.Author: 45DegreesNorth
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked as part of our Globus tour (a family tour). The first thing to know is that this hotel is about a 20 euro cab ride from city centre. It had a lovely swimming pool which we took full advantage of - it was Rome's first heat wave of the summer. We toured in the morning until around 1-2pm and headed back to the hotel for some pool time - everyone appreciated it. It brought us back to life for dining and walking in Rome central in the evening. I was not impressed by the dining room, it was servicable, that is as much as I could say. Not much of an ambience, more of a feeling of a sectioned-off room. The setting of the hotel is impressive - you could be anywhere, you are truly set apart from the hustle of the city. It is quite tranquil. Lots of lush trees. I believe that it borders on Rome's largest park. Our room was fine, with a balcony. Our son was with us, so we had a cot in the room for him. Everything worked fine. All in all, I would recommend this hotel to those who are going in the summer who want a place to get away from the touring for a little, to re-charge their batteries by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 4*+ Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MarkAdel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in September 2008 out of a total of 14 nights in Italy. Excellent rooms, nice pool and excellent connections into Rome with the complimentary transport. Great value, booking on-line with Wotif.com, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, spacious rooms and wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: Dutchees
Reviews.Content: For a Salesconference I had to arrange we ended up at this hotel In Rome...and it was a big hit! The hotel had everything well organized, amazing personell who did everything for us (even tracking shipments etc!) and the rooms were very spacious, clean and modern. It had internet access, CNN on the TV and many more! The conference rooms were perfect and everything had airconditioning. We loved the location! It's a 10 minutes drive from every highlight from Rome and costs appr. € 13,- per cab drive. Also they have hotel shuttles which work perfect as well and then they drop you off in the area of the Vatican. Perfect but as we were lazy we often took the cab. For your information, I also stayed afterwards at a hotel downtown Rome (close to the Colleseum) and I truly wished that I stayed at the Villa Pamphili. The noise you have downtown makes it hard to sleep at night and the price/quality is so huge that I would say.......stay at Villa Pamphili! They also had a wonderful pool where we were able to cool down! Overall...definetely a great hotel for privat visits to Rome ánd for Business trips/conferences!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lara1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as we wanted some where close to rome for sightseeing but with a pool. This hotel was a brilliant choice. The hotel itself is lovely, like a good 4* in this country. It has a lovely size pool which looks small but isn't at all (though no pool bar there is a bar inside hotel where you can get drinks but they are expensive). Staff were excellent and supplied us with map with all the sights on on our arrival. The hotel runs 2 shuttle bus's to 2 destinations all day from very early in the morning. The one bus drops you right outside the underground metro station which is easy to use and cheap! We caught these shuttle buses every day and only had problems on two days. One day we were getting an early bus and not everybody waiting got on the bus as it was full so had to wait 40 mins for the next one. The other time was the last bus home at 11, there was an ordally que formed when we arrived at the bus stop but when the bus arrived it was a bit of a free for all to get on and 4 people didn't fit and had to get taxis, this only happend the once though. As long as you're there 5/10 mintues before hand there are no problems. The only other problem is that the hotel bar and food is very very expensice (18 euros for a burger and chips, 14 euros for a toasted sandwhich on its on etc). We had breakfast included in the price of the room so bought stuff for our lunch when in rome the night before if we knew we were going to be staying around the hotel the next day. When in the hotel you cannot walk anywhere, only take the bus so you cannot walk to a shop or anything, you have to get supplies when you travel into rome. We also bought drinks in rome and put them in our mini bar to take to the pool the next day :) Those bad points really were tiny things, i would deffinately book this hotel again, the pool was an absolute godsend! as we were there in july it was boiling!! we had to give up sightseeing one day by 11am as it was just too hot!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Price”
Reviews.Author: MontrealCampobasso
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one evening, while in Rome, with two children. Were upgraded to a suite, at no extra charge. Shuttle bus back to the hotel can be a pain. No reason to provide a negative review to this hotel. Would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: allanjuno
Reviews.Content: We read some great reviews and some terrible reviews before booking and decided to take a chance. The rooms were great, big for Italy, clean and tidy and had everything you need. The corridors were a little 'tatty' and need to be painted/refurbished. Communal areas were fine also. The food in the restaurant was great for breakfast but only average for evening meal which we tried once. Other nights we were out in the City or Trastavere. The best thing about the hotel is that it is out of the city and you can escape to the comfort of the surroundings and a superb well run pool area. People complain about difficulty in transportation but the hotel supply buses which were perfect for getting you to a metro or tram stop and we used this all the time to good effect. The staff were fine if you didn't treat them like dirt and if you tried to use a little Italian they loved it. A number of North Americans complained loudly about items which were not really important and I was totally embarassed. If you just get on with your holiday and mould a little the hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again... but not in the rooms reserved for Tour Groups”
Reviews.Author: CiaoBigsy
Reviews.Content: In light of the negative reviews of this hotel, i can somewhat understand what guests are saying, this hotel as well as others in the same hotel chain, do cater to a lot of tour companies, however being on a tour you also seem to get the 2 star end of the 4 star hotel rooms. I also stayed here as part of a tour group and we booked our stay here 4 days in advance of our tour starting..our room was amazing beautiful, clean, great view of the hills.. but then we had to change rooms when our tour started...and the difference was night and day... not clean with a great view of the driveway... there are good points in staying here...the shuttle is great it drops you off and picks you up rght in front of Cipro Station/vaticani... this is two blocks south west of the Mercato Andria Doria....where you can pick up your food and stock up on drinks for the day before hopping on the subway..very cheap there and the fresh pizza is amazing. and about 5euros cheaper than in the center of the city. i would stay here again but not with a tour..

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here if you paid me”
Reviews.Author: well_travelled006
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a group. The carpet in the halls is filthy. The attitude of the staff is arrogant. Supper at the restaurant was horrible and grossly overpriced. The staff encourages you to eat the buffet for 28 Euros each plus drinks ($44.80+) The food looked like it had been sitting out for several hours or days. We chose to order from the menu. I had a plain, 12 inch, cheese pizza for 12 Euros ($19.00) and my husband ordered the veal for 20 Euros ($32.00) The veal, which is supposed to always be served well done, was served so rare that his plate quickly filled up with blood. The staff made no offers to make this situation right. Some others in our group ate from the buffet. They reported that the food was so cold it couldn't be eaten and when they asked that the food be warmed they were told that was impossible, didn't they want to select something else (just as cold) from the buffet. It would be one thing if the hotel just over charged for their meals, but to then serve food that can't be eaten is unforgivable.

Reviews.Title: “Woud sooner pitch a tent than stay here!”
Reviews.Author: MaryL31
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a group tour...we were assigned room #131...the bathroom door did not close properly; the sliding glass door was very difficult to open (my sister broke a nail trying to get it open)...the toilet flush had to be pressed 5 times in order to get it to flush; there were only very sheer curtains covering the glass doors, which meant that you had to dress in the dark if someone was using the bathroom while you were dressing; the shuttle bus driver did not explain to us that the bus that we were on was the wrong one (it was headed to Vatican City...we explained that we wanted to go to Trasteverde, and we were under the impression that our bus would stop there...it went only to Vatican City, which was a waste of time, as Vatican City is closed on Sundays); my sister got an "attitude" from the front desk when trying to obtain ice to keep her insulin pen cold; our room was over the entrance to the hotel, and there is no air conditioning at this time of year, which meant no sleep for us as we had to keep the sliding doors open for air, and there was constant noise from people coming and going until 1AM...we were not aware of the free shuttle at first, and being hungry, we were told that we could get a sandwich at the bar (restaurants's prices were, we thought, very high)...E15 for a chicken sandwich that had almost no chicken in it! I travel often, and NEVER do I expect perfection, but this place was the absolute pits! One of the worst hotels I've ever experienced, and I've been in many! Fortunately for us, this was the only bad hotel experience during this trip...we stayed in a total of 6 during this tour.

Reviews.Title: “Rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeffandtelena
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a gamble by going to www.hotels.com. hotels.com came up ATA Hotel Villa Phamphili. What a beautiful hotel. The service is absolutely wonderful. Our room was like the American hotel rooms in the U.S. A free shuttle drops you off at the Vatican and picks up at the same location. The hotel also offers a free shuttle to the Rome airport. They have a free breakfast buffet. The food is absolutely wonderful. When the shuttle drops you off at the Vatican, don't hesitate to stop by La Rusticana(a restuarant they my husband and I loved and frequented every evening for dinner). It's across from the shuttle stop to your left. La Rusticana is next to a gelato parlor(also excellent). My husband and I hope this review is helpful for you. We will be sure to stay at our hotel and visit La Rusticana and the gelato parlor.

Reviews.Title: “O.K. for tour groups, families with children”
Reviews.Author: MassLass
Reviews.Content: I was with a tour group who booked this hotel for our stay in Rome. It is a large hotel and it operates with a rather impersonal attitude. Our room was large and clean with a window overlooking the side lawn. The bathroom was clean in appearance but had an unpleasant odor that indicated poor ventilation. The dining area is large and service is adequate but impersonal. Our dinner meal was served banquet style with no choices offered and mediocre at best - our pasta was al dente to a fault! Breakfast was served cafeteria style with many selections to choose from and more appealing for this reason. We did not need the services of the hotel's shuttle bus since we had our own tour bus to visit Rome. The highlight of our stay was an evening in the bar where the pianist/singer entertained us with a great selection of Italian and American music. The lowlight of our stay was our inability to make use of an international phone card we had been using previously because we were unable to get an outside connection and the desk staff seemed unable and disinterested in helping.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn´t go back there even it it was free!”
Reviews.Author: TroMig
Reviews.Content: This is the WORST ****hotel you could ever imagine. This hotel has been given 4 stars but when was that ?! The room had doors to the other hotelrooms and it was not clean. The bathroom was in a very bad condition. The staff in the front desk was very rude, this seem to be the standard at this hotel. We had to wait more than 2 hours (we got there in the middle of the day) for our booked room. At the hotel there is a free courtesy bus service to the Vatican but the bus will not take you all the way there but only to a trainstation nearby (it takes appx. 20 min but the hotels webpage wrongly claims that it takes a few min.) that is if you can get a seat. There is 16 seats to all of the hotels guest and that is not enough, during the day and evening many will be left behind. The location of the hotel is too far away from anything incl. public transport, it will cost you around 20 EURO to get in/out to Rome every time you leave the hotel by taxi. Many people that left this hotel was clearly angry with the lack of service. There is only two good things to highlight at Villa Pamphili.. It does have a good breakfastservice in the morning and the swimingpool is big, but I wouldn´t go back there again even if it was free. By the way the swimingpool can not be used after 7pm. This hotel is rundown and should only be used if notthing else is available,and even in that case think twice! AtaHotel Villa Pamphili - No thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and a Good Value!”
Reviews.Author: drwiz
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights during Easter 08. The hotel was neat and clean and well maintained. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The hotel is a good value and the shuttle eliminated any problems with the location being a little off of the beaten path. If you are driving it is a little difficult to find, because of the location behind a major park area and many one way streets, but the shuttle service really means no car is required. I would recommend this hotel to my family and friends and would definitely stay again. It is a nice quiet location, away from street and other noises. The staff spoke excellent English and the complimentary breakfast was also very good. Lon and Mel V. Wooster, Ohio USA

Reviews.Title: “Out of the city - but worth the journey”
Reviews.Author: TCAL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. It was a great place to stay and at a good price, too - a lovely quiet place to return to at the end of a busy day's exploring. The room was large and comfortable, although the bathroom needed updating. The breakfast was plentiful, with a wide variety of foods to choose from; something for everyone's taste. The best morning entertainment is surely the watching the machine halving and squeezing the fruit to make your glass of orange juice! We used the shuttle bus lots and found it very reliable, but on one occasion three people were left behind due to lack of seats and one of the guests did complain to us that they had waited for a shuttle which had not turned up. However, the money saved by staying here rather than paying for a city centre hotel would more than cover the cost of a taxi if the shuttle bus let you down. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Michael_Delafield
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Villa Pamphilli was one of the highlights of our entire trip to Rome! From the minute we arrived until our departure we were impressed by the friendliness and helfulness of the entire staff - from the the front desk reception to the housekeeping staff. And, we were plesantly surprised by the setting, the flair and styling of the entire hotel from the lobby to the breakfast room to the our guest room including a balcony with patio furniture and throughout the hotel grounds i.e. patio, terrace and pool area! We would definitely stay at the Villa Pamphilli again and would recommend this hotel to friends! The breakfast selections were plentiful and of very high quality served by helpful and gracious waiters who eagerly brought beverages of your choice including fresh squeezed orange juice. We did not eat lunch or dinner at the restaurant, so cannot comment, although other guests did enjoy the Greek Salad they ordered. The location of the property is definitely outside the city center in a very quiet, parklike setting, and we found this to be a huge plus for relaxing. The hotel provides a shuttle service hourly to two different city drop-off and pick-up points, so getting into town was never a problem. Also, it was no problem at all to walk the 10-12 minutes to the #8 Tram or the "H" bus(1 Euro)for a short ride into the city.

Reviews.Title: “High standard and great pool”
Reviews.Author: The_J_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome soon after our wedding. Not to have an actual honeymoon but to get away for a few days before going back to work. We choose Villa Pamphilli because we got a nice deal and we really wanted a hotel in Rome with a pool area. We went there in the beginning of June (before the really hot summer of 2007 arrived) and had a few perfect days in Rome. The hotel is a bit outdated when it comes to interiors but it’s clean and fresh. We loved our room. It was quite big and had a large balconies of the hotel was not turned towards the city of Rome. The shuttle in to the nearest subway station was a must. Although a nice but needed complementary we would have liked it to have a few more departures a day. However, the Taxis wasn’t that expensive and we took one back every evening. We have noting to complain about concerning the room but the front desk wasn’t always that service minded. The lobby bar was good even though the menu depended a bit on the waiter. One day they didn’t serve burgers… no explanation. The restaurant was also quite good and we really enjoyed the breakfast. Yes, the hotel is a bit off but the standard is high and it was nice to zip some sun for a few hours.

Reviews.Title: “A bit run-down”
Reviews.Author: JF4175
Reviews.Content: This place was a disappointment. It's far from the center of Rome and needs updating. There is a free shuttle which drops you on a side street near a metro station sort of near the Vatican Museum. Not sure why they don't select a better drop off point. The bathrooms are old and there was dust and peeling wallpaper in the rooms. Nice property and pretty view. Staff was helpful if you caught them in the right mood; otherwise they could be a bit harsh.

Reviews.Title: “awesome view”
Reviews.Author: TravlingGurus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after our European Cruise Vacation. The hotels is in fact beautiful. Our room was excellent , comfortable and roomy. The bed was very comfortable. All rooms have balconies. Our room overlooked the beautiful pool with lucious colorful foliage. We had a great time here. There is free shuttle that takes you close to a train station to venture to your destination. The hotel features a resturant and a bar. In the evenings we would have a drink in the bar and listen to the piano player. Very nice and quiet. j&g Fort Worth, Tx

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: pierrealix
Reviews.Content: i must approve all the good reviews i've read on this hotel...very nice rooms with table and 2 chairs on the balcony huge swimming-pool excellent breakfast with fresh orange juice and a 10 metres long table full of good things to eat and above all a very very clean hotel.....now for the critics i ve read...the staff is very friendly and smiling from the "autista" (bus driver) to the manager the bartender the breakfast staff and the girls taking care of the swimming pool..but i heard some texan or californian women talking to the employees as they still were in Houston or Sacramento ..i think that some people should make efforts when they travelling abroad especially with people at their service..now for the real problem which is the location there's some good and some bad : the good part is that you're outside the city it's traffic jams & its noise and that you can sleep with open windows without hearing anything else that nightbirds..u can also have the benefits of a huge swimming pool which is impossible in the city....to go to town you have a nice free shuttle bus that within minutes take you near the vatican museums..services are 8am 845am and every 30 minutes till noon then again from 345pm to 745pm and after every hour..for the return to the hotel its every 30 mn from 9 to 12 and from 4pm to 8pm then every hour till the last one at 11pm..the real trouble is the gap in the siesta time so when you're downtown you have to rush back to take the bus at 12 or wait until 4pm knowing that churches and shops are ofter closed too during these hours ! (i must add ther'es also a free shuttle to & from the airport 4 times a day )but he hotel is not "out of nowhere" if you are not afraid of taking foreign public transports here's how you do..1. turn right when leaving the hotel then straight during 300 meters and you get bus 31 straight to Rome or even better 2.turn right when leaving then 1st on the right and after 150 meters 1st on the left : there you get at the "capolinea" (terminus) of tram 8 which leads you very fast (it has its own lane) to the marvelous Trastevere and its wonderful restaurants and across the river to Largo Argentina right in the heart of the antic Rome..next time i am in Rom..i shall return to this hotel for sure........Pierre from Paris

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, bad service for north americans”
Reviews.Author: ckcj
Reviews.Content: We were into our third week of an eight week tour of Europe. We had stayed at a mixture of hotels, villas, b and b's. The biggest problem with this place is its attitude - I say "its" b/c there almost appears to be a culture of dislike towards north american we have not seen on the rest of our trip, which has included paris and florence. This was the best hotel we have stayed at as far as amenities although the location is a bit out of the way. Count on either spending lots on cabs, figuring out bus schedules, or being confined to the shuttle service which will take you near the vatican. We consider ourselves to be friendly, easy-going people, and are not prone to giving places negative reviews. However, we felt compelled to write this review after we were ignored, treated rudely or snobbishly, or given lesser treatment than italian speakers or even people from the UK. This should simply not happen at a 4 star place, but it almost seemed like there was a culture of negativity towards north americans. If you are like me, the way you are treated by hotel staff can either make or break your stay. Some examples: being ignored on a number of occassions by restaurant staff when others were provided with attentive service; being accused of trying to "cue jump" because you intervened to help a UK couple communicate with a waitress; consistently being addressed in an unsmiling, stern manner by front desk and restaurant staff; having urgent requests for cabs "sat on" for several minutes, causing us to miss a train, and come close to missing another. Such snubs are even more troubling when you see Europeans being treated much better. I cannot recommend this place to anyone from N America.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but isolated”
Reviews.Author: pamtwig
Reviews.Content: My husband, my daughter and I stayed at the AtaHotel Villa Pamphilli 25-28 May 2007. Upon arrival we discovered that the hotel did not reserve a room for us with enough beds. So we had to wait an additonal hour for a room. I know mistakes happen, so this would not have been so bad if the hotel admitted fault. But they treated us like we inconveniencing them. We stood there as the two attendants argued over wheter to put us in a suite that was ready or make us wait for a standard room. You guessed it - we waited. I must say the staff behind the desk are very rude and stand offish. As far as the rest of staff, we found them to be very kind and helpful. The hotel itself was very nice. The rooms were spacious and very clean. The cleaning team came every morning about 0900 so if you want to sllep in don't forget to hand the sign on the door. The pool was great. Very large and also clean. The brakfast buffet was very good; simliar to a continental breakfast. They have an orange juice machine that squeezes fresh juice for you. This was a treat. Not to mention the cappucino. :-) The shuttle ran from the hotel to the main city every 30 minutes -(except midday (1200-1545) and the airport shuttle runs about 4 times a day. Leaving out of terminal C, cross the street where you will see the tourist bus, and look for the blue sign that reads Atahotel Villa Pamphilli. All in all we enjoyed our stay. Hoep this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible location -amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewMomCanada
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in an awful location for sightseeing - although not if all you wanted to see was the Vatican. However it is a beautiful hotel. The rooms are impeccably clean and average size for Europe. The pool is amazing and would be wonderful after a long day of sightseeing. It has free transfers to the airport. The directions to find it were terrible to bring a map and plot it out in advance. The breakfast was incredible with a full hot buffet breakfast. I would stay here in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: navigatornick
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights in this hotel end March for a Conference. Arrived 9pm day 1 - receptionist handed over my key card and started talking to another guest (who had butted in in Italian) without pointing out where the lifts or my room were. As one of the digits on the keycard folder was not clear I had to wait. Then I got to the room and rang for some room service. Phone rang twice for 2 minutes - no reply. I called reception who said they would get the restaurant to phone me - 20 minutes later and still no call so I phoned again and the restaurant finally called to take my order which took another 30 minutes to arrive. After that not so bad. I stayed here some 3 years ago and the rest was about the same - food average, room and housekeeping were fine. They have a big pool but it was still shut. The good thing is the location next to the park and the shuttle buses to/from the airport and into the centre with a drop-off point near the Vatican. Personally I would avoid staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs improving in many areas”
Reviews.Author: chasman1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in late Sep 06. I was there with my wife and 5 yr old son. We've been to Europe a few times and are fortunate to travel quite a lot. Pros - 1. You should get a quiet night's sleep as there is no street noise (however, we could hear the unit above leaving early for the airport one morning). 2. Huge pool (although no atmosphere down there and mandatory use of swim caps that they provide and no shallow end for little kids.) 3. Free breakfast buffet (I think this is common in European hotels) 4. The staff is pretty friendly (except for the front desk crew - more on that in a minute) 5. 80% of rooms face towards the pool area and 100% have decks. 6. Clean bathrooms in rooms. 7. Free Shuttle bus service into Rome (but, not always on time - more on that in a minute) 8. Price of about $200 US/per night reasonable value in Rome. Cons 1. Location - you are definitely not going to walk to anything. It's in a strange little suburb on the outskirts of Rome. 2. Finding the place in a rental car - this was a complete disaster that I can laugh about now. i tried following the directions on their website to no avail. if you are coming in from the North keep in mind that Via della Nocetta is one way going North! There is no sign indicating where Via Leone XIII is. (getting on it actually feels like a highway on-ramp) I was so desperate that I wound up going the wrong way down the one way street with Italians yelling at me! Ha! Another car ahead of me shared the same fate and was trying to go backwards! Terrible signage. (this hotel appears to cater to seniors on bus tours.) I mentioned this to the front desk staff and was met with bored, smiling looks. 3. Indifferent hotel staff at the front desk - we tried to change rooms upon arriving because they gave us 3 single beds. the young girls behind the counter need more training. every request is met with the untrue mantra, "sorry we are all full tonight," with forced smiles. I spoke to the manager and got moved the following night. 4. The free shuttles into Rome are on Europe time. The shuttle is on a posted schedule so one morning we went down at 10:05am to catch the 10:15am shuttle. It showed up at 10:25am and then we all jumped in along with some American seniors. We sat there while the driver then had to have his smoke break. Ha! The other shuttle bus showed up and there was some confusion and we jumped into that second bus instead which wound up leaving right away. Man, those angry seniors almost started a riot because they got left behind in the other bus! One old timer pounded the side of the bus with his fist! (It's about a 15 Euro taxi ride into town.) 5. No internet access. There is a bizarre Atari looking console at the base of the stairs. While we were there they had a sign that said that there was a weird new law that precluded them from offering internet services. 6. The place could use some new carpeting and a splash of paint. It has a early 80's feel to it. 7. No English newspapers offered. 8. We got back to our room around 4:45pm one day and our room had not yet been cleaned. As an aside - we flew out of Ciampino airport. It took us 33 minutes to get there without traffic and without getting lost. The front desk said an hour. Ciampino has very few amenities. I should have checked in my baggage with Ryan Air 2.5 hrs ahead of time and then driven in my rental car to a lunch place nearby and returned with 30 minutes to go. We were stuck there for about 4 hours as the flight was delayed. It's a tiny airport and you can get through pretty quick. It's a lot of hurry up and wait there. I do not believe I will stay here or fly down with Ryan Air again. Believe it or not, I do not consider myself that picky a traveller. Keep in mind no one does service like Americans do. A 4 star in Europe is more like a 2.5 star in Vegas for example. Bon voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Five fantastic days in Rome”
Reviews.Author: laserg
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Villa Pamphili August 3-5, 2006 with my wife and two teenage sons. We arrived to find out our reservations were "not in the system," but after ten minutes of nervous waiting, the hotel manager offered the presidential suite for all of us and a second room for our sons for the other 4 nights. It was a wonderful stay. The room was the largest in the hotel with two balconies and an in-room sauna and jacuzzi. NICE. The pool is huge and well maintained. The staff is fantastic, professional and friendly. The breakfeast spread was generous and delicious and the host was so nice and friendly. The location is out of the way, but they offer FREE shuttle service to the Vatican every half hour (talk about saving money on cab fares!) I would recommend the Villa Pamphili without resevation. Go and enjoy Rome!

Reviews.Title: “ATA Hotel Villa Pamphilli is a very nice property.”
Reviews.Author: Travelswell4fun
Reviews.Content: This review is on the ATA Hotel Villa Pamphilli in Rome, Italy. We visited the first week of July, 2006 while on a Trafalgar Tour. We liked the hotel very much. It was definitely a nice property. Probably was a premier resort at one time. I say this because it is obvious they used to be big into tennis tournaments/meets, etc. as they have about 12 clay courts, spectator areas, etc. that have fallen into disrepair. It is such a shame too, because it was probably THE place to play a few years ago. That being said, this hotel obviously also caters to small conventions as well. It is located just on the outskirts of Rome. Literally, it is on the perimeter of chaos and tranquillity. Nice place! They have a free shuttle every thirty minutes that drops/picks-up on the edge of the Vatican where there is the tube/subway to get to everything else. The rooms are huge, clean, beautifully appointed and comfortable. The A/C in our room was awesome. Controlled by us. There is a private balcony overlooking either the pool or the gardens. The bathrooms are huge, clean, comfortable and have good water pressure, temperature and flow in the shower. Luxury. The lobby is beautiful with helpful staff. Nice bar. But don't even consider getting a bucket of ice after 10:00 at night. When room service closes, so does the ice. Don't go to the bar for one; you'll get one cup. One. Begrudgingly. Tip expected. The restaurant provided a descent breakfast buffet. Most unfortunately however, the dinner there was the worst meal in a restaurant I have ever had. Ever. Anywhere. (Serves me right. You don't go to Rome to eat in the hotel restaurant. Circumstances for us at that time precluded our other desires. Further, you are kind of isolated from everything when you stay here). Overall, you must highly consider this hotel. I can recommend it without hesitation. Since you don't know me, I'll tell you we only consider places that are a cut above. We can and do stay in nice places exclusively. We like class. You will be happy at this hotel if you like the same. No problems.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel!”
Reviews.Author: frankcom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Villa Pamphili from Oct 4th to 9th, 2005. Room was large, modern, and clean. Hotel employees were courteous and helpful. Breakfast was excellent. It is on the outskirts of the city, but it only cost a 12 to 16 Euro cab ride to get anywhere touristy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, facilities, locaition and wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: musmaestro
Reviews.Content: Last week in September ('05) for 5 nights was a welcome return to Villa Pamphili where I have stayed many times as an individual. Additionally, my organization has booked a number of groups, both adult and student, at this hotel and have never been disappointed. The courteous service given by the front desk is always outstanding and with the added security benefit of not being right in the center with congestion and other problems, this is an ideal hotel. Their courtesy vans are always ready to take visitors where they want to go and pick them up to return them safely to the hotel. Food quality of the restaurants is excellent and the breakfast is superior to that of most other upscale hotels in Italy. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel, especially to the first time Rome visitor. You won't be disappointed! Dr. J. Herbert, Philadelphia

HotelInfo.Name: ATAHOTEL Villa Pamphili
HotelInfo.Address: Via Della Nocetta 105 | (Vicino al Parco Villa Doria Pamphili), 00164 Rome, Italy
